content.description:
Climb up the ramp to start then make balancy moves up to reach some small flakes.   Commit to the small crimps and reach for bigger and better holds.

Continue on up the blunt arete moving right at the top to reach the anchors.

climbs.name: Wild Child
climbs.fa: Dave Bridges & Mike Rigney, July 1989, FL: Brad Singer & John Cardmon, July 2000

content.description: Make a hard pull passed the first bolt to get established on the face.   Continue up using the large flake / layaway passed two more bolts to finish.

climbs.name: Wild Boys
climbs.fa: Dave Bridges, Mike Rigney, July 1989, First Lead: Brad Singer, John Cardmon, July 2000

content.description: Climb the crack on the right of the wall until a long reach allows a good flake to be grasped.   Passed the second bolt a nice sequence of moves gets you off the overhanging face, and lets you finish easily up ramp.
content.protection: 3 bolts, chain anchors (optional small cam protects the starting moves).
content.location: Rightmost route on the overhanging face.

climbs.name: Wild at Heart
climbs.fa: Chris Miller, Pete Paredes & Brad Singer, July 2000

content.description:
Make balancy moves up to the 1st bolt.   After clipping this bolt make a big move up to the rounded break.

Another sequence of moves gets your hands on huge holds over the overhang.   Grasp these and make some nice moves onto the top.
content.location: The rightmost route on the cliff.

content.description:
This climb comes at you quickly.

Reach the slanting rounded rail and make the 1st bolt clip.   Now move fast using a good left crimp and make a hard move up to a sloper and then the break.

With the break reached better holds are soon available.   With the crux done, cruise up the remainder of the climb, finishing up to the right.
content.location: Climbs the face behind the dead tree.

content.description:
Start up the crack with a technical sequence of moves.   As you gain height the crack gets better, and when a good sidepull in the crack is reached the difficulties are behind you.

Finish more easily up the wider crack / scoop.
content.protection:
Trad Gear. Fairly difficult to arrange.

2 bolt anchor/rap (shared with

The Bounder

).
content.location: Middle of the wall, to the right of the steep bolted section.

content.description:
Wiggle up the wide crack and once past the second horizontal crack cut right to finish with the last two bolts on

Wild at Heart

.
content.protection:
TR from bolts atop

Wild at Heart

.
content.location:
Located between

Wild Abandon

and

Wild at Heart

.

content.description:
Unprotected face climbing gains a crack which is followed to the top. Gear belay or traverse right to anchors on

Marty Moose

and set a directional for the follower.
content.location:
Located between

Wild Boys

and

Marty Moose

.

content.description:
Start up the ramp on the left, then traverse underneath the first bolt. Clip the bolt and make a great sequence of moves up to the 2nd bolt, where a brief rest is possible.

Commit to the final sequence, pass the 3rd bolt and make the sloper finish.

A good climb.

A sequence of hard moves on sloping breaks allows a quartz dike to the reached on the left.

The moves up the dike are much easier, and lead to a fist size groove which leads to the anchors.
content.location: First bolted route passed the central crack.
